companyDescription:
The Ottawa Hospital is one of Canada’s largest learning and research hospitals, with more than 1,100 beds, approximately 12,000 staff members and an annual budget of about $1.2 billion. 

Our focus on learning and research helps us develop new and innovative ways to treat patients and improve care. As a multi-campus hospital affiliated with the University of Ottawa, we deliver specialized care to the Eastern Ontario region, but our techniques and research discoveries are adopted around the world. We engage the community at all levels to support our vision for better patient care.

From the compassion of our people to the relentless pursuit of new discoveries, The Ottawa Hospital never stops seeking solutions to the most complex health-care challenges.
preprocessed_description: About The Ottawa Hospital Inspired by research and driven by compassion! The Ottawa Hospital (TOH) is one of Canada's largest learning and research multi-campus hospitals. With more than 1,100 beds and approximately 12,000 staff members, we deliver specialized care to the Eastern Ontario region. From the compassion of our people to the relentless pursuit of new discoveries, The Ottawa Hospital never stops seeking solutions to the most complex health-care challenges while continually engaging with the community to support our vision for better patient care. Working together with its research institute, the University of Ottawa, and other partners, the hospital is continually gaining national and international recognition for high-quality patient care, teaching and research, while striving to meet the needs of the culturally diverse community we serve. Position Information This is a corporate position with a home base at the Civic Campus. Rotation/Shifts Days, including weekends, 8 hour shifts. For information purposes only - The Hospital reserves the right to change. Basic Requirements Biomedical technologist diploma or Electronics Technologist Diploma; Minimum of six (6) months relevant experience; Knowledge of legislative safety requirements, Ontario Hydro Electrical Safety Code, and CSA Standards; Ability to understand the links and inter-connectivity of various electronic systems; Ability to understand and interpret schematic diagrams; Ability to service and calibrate electro-medical equipment; Skilled in the use of electrical or electronic measuring devices; Basic knowledge of general physics and anatomy; Integrates critical thinking, education and relevant practical experience in technical problem solving approach; Demonstrated ability to use MS Office applications with emphasis on Excel. Perform basic data analysis. Produce charts and reports as required; Excellent customer service and relation management skills; Excellent knowledge in the use of a computerized maintenance management system; Excellent teamwork skills; Clear written and verbal communication skills is a must; Availability for overtime, weekend support, call-back and flexibility in hours of work as required; Working knowledge of WHMIS. Preferred Qualifications Certified Biomedical Engineering Technologist (CBET); Registered with OACETT; Demonstrated ability to create work instructions; Relevant research equipment and/or lab equipment knowledge and experience; Understanding of laboratory documentation and accreditation requirements; Demonstrated knowledge of microscopes, analyzers, microtomes, etc; Demonstrated ability to plan and prioritize tasks, anticipate problems and deviations with daily or monthly plans to meet assigned and personal objectives; Experience in electromedical equipment support including vital signs monitor, defibrillators, infusion pumps, feeding pumps, thermometers; Proven ability to working in an Intensive Care, Operating Room, and Patient Care, Laboratory, Research and Pathology environments; JOHSC Experience and training. What you can expect from us The Ottawa Hospital is committed to providing a healthy, safe, and inclusive work environment for everyone. We are driven by our purpose to provide each patient with the world-class care, exceptional service and compassion we would want for our loved ones. We offer an attractive and equitable compensation package including a comprehensive benefits package, a Defined Benefit Pension (DBP) plan, and insurance protection. We also offer discounts from choice providers on a variety of products and services. The Ottawa Hospital provides various Health and Wellness resources as well as opportunities for personal and professional development opportunities from our in-house Learning and Leadership Development team to help align your goals with your career objectives. Interested? Apply today! If you are passionate about what you do, motivated by improving the health of the community, excited by leading-edge medical technology, and as committed to excellence, quality and patient safety as we are, we would like to hear from you. Please submit an on-line application for the position you are interested in. We thank all those who apply but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. The Ottawa Hospital is an equal opportunity employer. Upon request, accommodations due to a disability are available throughout the recruitment process.
